title: Three charges arranged in equilaterial triangle

content.question: Three particles, A, B, and C, have equal positive charges ùëÑ and are held in place at the vertices of an equilateral triangle with sides of length ‚Ñì , as shown in the figures below. The dotted lines represent the bisectors for each side. The base of the triangle lies on the x-axis, and the altitude of the triangle lies on the y-axis. (a) Point P1, the intersection of the three bisectors, locates the geometric center of the triangle and is one point where the electric field is zero. On Figure 1 above, draw the electric field vectors EA, EB, and EC at P1 due to each of the three charges. Be sure your arrows are drawn to reflect the relative magnitude of the fields. Another point where the electric field is zero is point P2 at (0, y2). On Figure 2 above, draw electric field vectors EA, EB, and EC at P2 due to each of the three point charges Indicate below whether the magnitude of each of these vectors is greater than, less than, or the same as for point P1. (b) Explain why the x-component of the total electric field is zero at any point on the y-axis. (c) Write a general expression for the electric potential V at any point on the y-axis inside the triangle in terms of ùëÑ, ‚Ñì, and y. (d) Describe how the answer to part (c) could be used to determine the y-coordinates of points P1 and P2 at which the electric field is zero. (You do not need to actually determine these coordinates.)
